usefulItems: rolling pin, baking trays, baking paper, oven, grill
title: Sweet Potato Crust Pizza

ingredients.content: 2 - 3 sweet potatoes (approx. 300-350 g), peeled, diced (2-3 cm)
½ - 1 tsp dried mixed herbs, to taste
60 g pepperoni, or topping of choice

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C and line 2 baking trays with baking paper.
Place chickpeas in mixing bowl and grind <b>2 min/speed 10<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
Place water and sweet potatoes in mixing bowl then cook <b>15-20 min/98°C/speed 0.5<b> until tender. Drain sweet potatoes in Varoma dish then return to mixing bowl.
Add 300 g reserved chickpea flour, bicarbonate of soda, mixed herbs and salt then mash <b>10 sec/speed 3<b> (see tip). Leave bowl to cool below 60°C then knead <b>2 min/<b>.

Tip dough out onto a floured surface. Divide into 2 pieces and roll or press each out to a circle (approx. Ø 25 cm, 5 mm thick). Place on prepared trays then bake for 15-20 minutes (200°C) until edges are slightly browned. Meanwhile, make tomato sauce.
Place garlic, onions and oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>.

Add tomatoes, tomato purée, oregano, salt and pepper then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, simmer <b>15 min/98°C/speed 1<b> (see tip). Meanwhile, when bases are cooked, remove from oven and preheat grill to 220°C.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over pizza bases then top with grated Cheddar and pepperoni, or topping of choice. Grill for 3-4 minutes (220°C) until cheese has melted. Serve warm with a green salad.

hintsAndTricks: An alternative gluten-free pizza base that's easy with Thermomix. In this nutritious option you make your own chickpea flour before mixing it with steamed sweet potatoes to create a simple yet tasty allergy-friendly pizza base. Just bake the bases, add your favourite toppings and grill for a few minutes – it’s that simple!
If the mixture looks too dry to form a rollable dough, add a little water after mashing in <b>step 4.<b>
Simmer the tomato sauce for longer for a thicker consistency.
For a smoother tomato sauce, after simmering in <b>step 7<b>, blend <b>1 min/speed 5-7,<b> increasing speed gradually<b>.
